item.title: NY Port Hustles to Cut Logjam Amid Labor Woes...
item.description:
www.bnnbloomberg.ca
The Port of New York and New Jersey is working to clear a small but rare bottleneck of container ships anchored off the coast of Long Island as Covid-19 cases among dockworkers collide with a pandemic-fueled surge in cargo volumes.

item.title: Watershed moment: New law allows noncitizens to vote...
item.description:
apnews.com
NEW YORK (AP) — More than 800,000 noncitizens and “Dreamers” in New York City will have access to the ballot box — and could vote in municipal elections as early as next year — after Mayor Eric Adams allowed legislation to automatically become law Sunday.

item.description:

item.title: Duchess of Cambridge, the reliable royal, turns 40...
item.description:
apnews.com
LONDON (AP) — At least there’s Kate. The Duchess of Cambridge, who turns 40 on Sunday, has emerged as Britain’s reliable royal. After Prince Harry and Meghan’s stormy departure to California in 2020, the death of Prince Philip last year, and now sex abuse allegations against Prince Andrew, the former Kate Middleton remains in the public eye as the smiling mother of three who can comfort grieving parents at a children's hospice or wow the nation by playing piano during a televised Christmas concert.

item.title: Hospital turns to heated tent to ease crush...
item.description:
apnews.com
MUSKEGON, Mich. (AP) — A hospital in western Michigan is using a heated tent as extra emergency space due to a surge in COVID-19 cases. The tent at Mercy Health Muskegon was set up a few weeks ago but put into service Thursday, WOOD-TV reported.

item.title: Turkmenistan leader wants 'Gates of Hell' fire put out...
item.description:
apnews.com

item.title: Navy expands boot camp to sharpen focus on character issues...
item.description:
apnews.com
WASHINGTON (AP) — The Navy is adding two weeks to boot camp this year in a major overhaul aimed at improving recruits' war fighting and emergency skills while also focusing on suicide prevention and character issues such as sexual assault, hazing and extremism in the ranks.
